exceptions.exn: In environment A : Type B : Type C : Type R : C -> rel A B x : A y : B P, Q : Prop H : forall c : C, RElim (R c) x y P Q c : B Unable to unify "R ?M1639 x y" with "exists c0 : C, R c0 x c".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

A: Type
B: Type
C: Type
R: C -> rel A B
x: A
y: B
Q: Prop
P: Prop

Goal:
(forall c : C, RElim (R c) x y P Q) -> RElim (rexists y, R y) x y P Q

Premises:
RElim = fun (A B : Type) (R : rel A B) (m : A) (n : B) (P Q : Prop) => R m n -> P -> Q : forall A B : Type, rel A B -> A -> B -> Prop -> Prop -> Prop Arguments RElim {A B}%type_scope _%rel_scope _ _ (_ _)%type_scope
rel = fun A1 A2 : Type => A1 -> A2 -> Prop : Type -> Type -> Type Arguments rel (_ _)%type_scope
rel_all_relim : forall (R0 : ?C -> rel ?A ?B) (x0 : ?A) (y0 : ?B) (P0 Q0 : Prop), (exists c : ?C, RElim (R0 c) x0 y0 P0 Q0) -> RElim (rforall y, R0 y) x0 y0 P0 Q0 where ?A : [A : Type B : Type C : Type R : C -> rel A B x : A y : B P : Prop Q : Prop |- Type] ?B : [A : Type B : Type C : Type R : C -> rel A B x : A y : B P : Prop Q : Prop |- Type] ?C : [A : Type B : Type C : Type R : C -> rel A B x : A y : B P : Prop Q : Prop |- Type]
relim = fun (A B : Type) (R : rel A B) (m : A) (n : B) (P Q : Prop) (RElim : RElim R m n P Q) => RElim : forall (A B : Type) (R : rel A B) (m : A) (n : B) (P Q : Prop), RElim R m n P Q -> R m n -> P -> Q Arguments relim {A B}%type_scope {R}%rel_scope {m n} {P Q}%type_scope {RElim}
rel_all = fun (A B C : Type) (R : C -> rel A B) (x : A) (y : B) => forall c : C, R c x y : forall A B C : Type, (C -> rel A B) -> rel A B Arguments rel_all {A B C}%type_scope _%function_scope
rel_ex = fun (A B C : Type) (R : C -> rel A B) (x : A) (y : B) => exists c : C, R c x y : forall A B C : Type, (C -> rel A B) -> rel A B Arguments rel_ex {A B C}%type_scope _%function_scope
rel_ex_rintro : forall (R0 : ?C -> rel ?A ?B) (c : ?C) (m : ?A) (n : ?B), RExists (R0 c m n) (rexists y, R0 y) m n where ?A : [A : Type B : Type C : Type R : C -> rel A B x : A y : B P : Prop Q : Prop |- Type] ?B : [A : Type B : Type C : Type R : C -> rel A B x : A y : B P : Prop Q : Prop |- Type] ?C : [A : Type B : Type C : Type R : C -> rel A B x : A y : B P : Prop Q : Prop |- Type]

apply rel_all_rintro.
intros c.
apply H.

original: intros H. apply rel_all_rintro. intros c. apply H.
